Tips_WL00_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_001_00_Description.text: Try pressing the Scan button after arriving in a world for the first time. Particles will fly throughout the area. When the scan is complete, a vision will appear at your destination. Even if you've already done a scan in a world, there are some occasions when you can scan again.

Tips_WL00_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_002_00_Description.text: The string of light connecting a vision to a protagonist is called a wave. Interacting with visions causes all sorts of events to occur, and engaging with such events drives the game forward. There are even times when new visions appear as you progress.

Tips_WL00_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_003_00_Description.text: Visions often contain story events that drive the game forward. By pressing the Rewind button during such events, you can go back through the story and make new choices if you wish. Visions of this type sometimes contain other events as well, such as fights or ritgram puzzles.

Tips_WL00_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_007_00_Description.text: Visions sometimes contain combat events. If you see combat information being displayed, make use of it to plan your strategy.

Tips_WL00_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_008_00_Description.text: Visions may sometimes cause ritgram events to occur. If a shard acquired elsewhere is required to solve it, you will see shard information displayed. You can choose whether or not to tackle visions like these after ensuring you have the necessary shards.

Tips_BA_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BA_000_00_Description.text: Ritgrams are puzzles solved by combining shards to create shapes. Once all the shards have been put together to create a specific shape, the puzzle will be complete. Some ritgrams can only be completed by removing shards that have already been placed and replacing them with something else, while others have only one specific way they can be solved.

Tips_BA_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BA_001_00_Description.text: You can review all the ritgrams you've encountered via the Ritgrams Notes section of the menu. If there's a ritgram you're eager to solve, you can check there to see if you have all the shards required to solve it before heading to the event that contains it.

Tips_BA_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BA_002_00_Description.text: If you'd like to record the progress you've made on your adventure—or pick things up from a previous record— try pressing the Save / Load button. Make sure not to turn off the power or close the game while any kind of saving or loading is in progress.

Tips_BA_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BA_003_00_Description.text: Choose New Game to begin a brand new adventure. Even if you already have a playthrough going, starting a new game will allow you to undertake a new adventure with a different protagonist. Choosing Continue will resume your adventure from your most recently saved data.

Tips_BA_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BA_004_00_Description.text: Resume your adventure using saved data belonging to a protagonist other than the one you're currently using. Start the game with the Play Using Other Data option on the title screen. You can have saved data for a variety of protagonists and store it on a per-playthrough basis. Saved data can be deleted here as well.

Tips_BA_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BA_005_00_Description.text: After completing the game, you can kick off a new playthrough via the New Game option on the title screen. If you would like to access data saved before this point, you can find it by choosing the Play Using Other Data option on the title screen.

Tips_WL00_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_010_00_Description.text: Pressing the Scan Results button will bring up a list of all currently available visions and waves. If there are any visions that interest you, marking it will bring up an indicator that leads you straight to it.

Tips_WL00_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_004_00_Description.text:
Visions marked with a <emoji ScanWavePin01> symbol are critical to
the main story, whereas visions marked with
a <emoji ScanWavePin03> symbol are side events that bear no direct
relation to the main story. Finally, visions
marked with a <emoji ScanWavePin02> symbol contain battles,
making them the perfect choice for those looking
to power up their retinue.

Tips_RE00_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_RE00_000_00_Description.text: The many worlds are connected by a place called the Junction. While there, try pressing the Scan button. Particles will fly around you, and when the scan is complete, a door leading to your destination will appear. Follow the wave to the door and begin your adventure!

Tips_RE00_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_RE00_001_00_Description.text: The act of traveling directly to a specific world is called direct warping. In the Junction, it is possible to hop directly to any world you've previously visited. After navigating to the Scan Results screen, swap to the Direct Warp tab and choose a world to visit.

Tips_RE00_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_RE00_002_00_Description.text: Pressing the Emerald Ride button while in the Junction will place you directly on top of a wave, allowing you to travel through the area at high speeds. Give it a try the next time you find a lot of distance between yourself and a door.

Tips_RE00_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_RE00_003_00_Description.text: Pressing the High Speed button while in the Junction will allow a mech to travel at higher speeds than normal. Give it a try the next time you find a lot of distance between yourself and the door you're planning to use.

Tips_WL21_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL21_000_00_Description.text:
There are a number of special actions that can only
be performed in specific worlds. Whenever you visit
a new world, listen closely to whatever the various
inhabitants have to say, and try not to skip any
help messages that happen to pop up.

Tips_WL08_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL08_000_00_Description.text:
Tope can tunnel through various places here.
Try walking along walls to find them.

Tips_WL09_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL09_000_00_Description.text: Pressing the Panorama Map button will let you scope out the entirety of Avalon.

Tips_WL14_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL14_000_00_Description.text:
You can spin the world while sitting in the chair,
and intervene in any visions that appear directly
in front of you.

Tips_WL19_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL19_000_00_Description.text: Pressing the Call Eagle button will let you blow a flute that summons an eagle friend. Doing so gives you a bird's-eye view of the world, and even lets you return to your starting location with your seeds and bugs reset if you so choose.

Tips_BT01_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_000_00_Description.text: Choose what techs and spells characters will use, as well as who their targets will be. Once actions have been entered for all characters, press the Confirm button to proceed to the confirmation screen. Once there, press the Engage! button to jump into the action. Victory is achieved by defeating every enemy on the battlefield.

Tips_BT01_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_001_00_Description.text: Generally speaking, there are two types of actions: techs, which are performed immediately, and spells, which take some time to chant before they can be performed. A character who is not assigned either of these actions will defend.

Tips_BT01_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_002_00_Description.text: There are two types of defense: blocking and evading. Blocking reduces the power of incoming attacks, while evading dodges the attack completely. Some weapons and techs make it more likely for defensive maneuvers to occur before or after a character acts.

Tips_BT01_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_003_00_Description.text: A character's HP decreases as they take damage. Should a character's HP reach 0 during battle, they will be removed from the action. While HP is completely restored after each battle, there's no way to replenish it during a fight.

Tips_BT01_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_004_00_Description.text: LP is lost when a character's HP reaches zero. When all of a character's LP has been depleted, they will no longer be able to participate in battles. Should this happen, remove them from your combat retinue and give them some time to rest—their LP will gradually return as they sit on the sidelines. The entire retinue's LP will be completely restored when you change worlds, and it's also possible to keep members in the action nonstop by giving them roles that restore LP.

Tips_BT01_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_005_00_Description.text: Performing techs and spells consumes BP, which is shared amongst the entire retinue. Each tech and spell has its own set BP cost, so try to make the most of the resources you have. Any BP used will be replenished at the start of each turn. Note that the enemy is subject to the same BP limitations as the player.

Tips_BT01_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_006_00_Description.text: The timeline along the bottom of the screen shows the order in which characters will act during combat. The farther a character is to the left, the sooner they will act. Conversely, being farther to the right means acting later. Some techs and spells can change a character's action order.

Tips_BT01_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_007_00_Description.text: When allies string together the <emoji CoopRange01>combo ranges of their techs and spells, they will perform a United Attack. Actions that <emoji CoopRange04>cannot be used in a combo will break the string, and actions with a <emoji CoopRange05>combo range of 0 will be skipped. The more characters that participate in a United Attack, the higher your shared combo rate will climb—and the more damage you will dish out.

Tips_BT01_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_008_00_Description.text: Overdrive happens when a handful of chosen characters perform another United Attack after the first one ends. Your retinue has a chance of kicking into overdrive when your combo rate reaches 150%, with overdrive being guaranteed once you've reached 200%. Your combo rate also affects how many characters participate in an overdrive combo.

Tips_BT01_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_009_00_Description.text: Characters surrounded by two empty spaces on either side of them in the timeline will execute a showstopper. During a showstopper, the character will execute a United Attack by themselves using the techs and spells that they have learned. The showstopper will continue for as long as there is BP remaining to consume. Effects which activate at the start or conclusion of a United Attack will not be applied.

Tips_BT01_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_010_00_Description.text: The vast majority of battles can be reattempted so long as the characters in your battle retinue have LP remaining. You will have a higher starting combo rate in battles you reattempt, while growths and LP losses incurred will be carried over. Should a battle give you trouble over and over you might want to try other approaches, like changing your formation or enhancing your armaments.

Tips_BT01_011_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_011_00_Description.text:
You can review information about a battle before jumping
into it, giving you the chance to review details about
enemies you've fought before, items that can be acquired,
and any trials you've accepted from Mr. S.
After looking over this information, you can either jump
right into the action or take a moment to prepare.

Tips_BT01_012_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT01_012_00_Description.text:
Defeating enemies in battle lets you acquire items once the
engagement is complete. Also, should you destroy things
like stones or chunks of ore that appear during battle,
you just might receive special items for your trouble.
Battles with stones or wooden boxes can be won without
destroying them, but if you're interested in acquiring
as many items as possible, make an effort to target them.

Tips_BT02_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_000_00_Description.text:
Choose five members of your group to take to the battlefield as
your combat retinue. Members who currently have 0 LP or are
undergoing Mr. S's tutelage cannot join the combat retinue.
Should you ever find yourself up against foes that are giving
you trouble, try putting different characters into your retinue.

Tips_BT02_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_001_00_Description.text: Battles are fought with your retinue organized into what's called a formation. Your formation affects many things, including your starting BP and how it increases throughout a fight, what modifiers are applied to your attack power and defense, and what other effects are shared across your retinue. There are also times when a character's placement within a formation yields further effects. Formations are sometimes acquired when someone joins your retinue for the first time.

Tips_BT02_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_002_00_Description.text: It is possible to designate a sixth person as a support retinue member who will assist in fights without directly participating in combat. Some characters even possess special support roles that yield helpful benefits in battle and activate only when placed in your support retinue. Not that some characters are actually incapable of fighting, and cannot participate in any capacity outside of your support retinue.

Tips_BT02_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_003_00_Description.text: Armaments are separated into weapons, main armor, and auxiliary armor depending on where they are equipped. The number and type of armaments a character can equip is determined by their race. Additionally, there are some armaments that are race-specific. A character who has no weapon equipped will fight using martial arts.

Tips_BT02_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_004_00_Description.text: Any techs and spells you have learned can be equipped and removed at will. However, techs cannot be performed in battle unless you've also equipped a weapon capable of using it. Some armaments come with their own tech or spell attached, which will be indicated with a light bulb icon. In such cases, you must equip the weapon before the tech or spell can be set.

Tips_BT02_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_005_00_Description.text:
Mechs do not possess specific equipment slots for weapons,
main armor, and auxiliary armor. Armaments can be equipped to
any open slot, and mech techs will be automatically set depending
on the armaments they are outfitted with.

Tips_BT02_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_006_00_Description.text: Characters can be equipped with something called roles. Roles possess a wide range of effects, and can be used to enhance members or your retinue in various ways. Some roles can be acquired by learning techs and spells, but there are others that some characters are simply born with. There are a number of roles—called souls—that can only be equipped by kugutsu. Souls are equipped to different slots than other roles.

Tips_BT02_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_007_00_Description.text: Pressing the Optimize Armaments button will automatically set you up with an armament and tech/spell loadout that fits the conditions you specify.

Tips_BT02_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_010_00_Description.text: Materials are used to enhance weapons and armor, and can be acquired by winning battles. Materials can also be earned as rewards for completing trials assigned by Mr. S.

Tips_BT02_011_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_011_00_Description.text: Concepts are used to enhance weapons and armor, and can be gleaned by advancing the story or winning battles. Unlike materials, concepts can never be lost once acquired.

Tips_BT02_012_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT02_012_00_Description.text: Armaments in your possession can be combined with other things to create new armaments. Doing this, however, requires components called materials, and may sometimes require special components called concepts as well.

Tips_WL00_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_WL00_009_00_Description.text: Trading is a system by which you can exchange items with others by putting your own items up for sale or bidding on things that have been put up by someone else. If you trade diligently, you may stumble on some delightfully unusual finds. Item Trading can be done at any time, and trades are updated every time you change worlds or finish a battle.

Tips_BT_MONSTER_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT_MONSTER_008_00_Description.text:
Earn items by accepting trials from Mr. S and completing
them in combat. The number of trials available increases
as various conditions are met, so be sure to attempt them
often and win as many valuable items as possible.

Tips_BT_CHARACTER_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT_CHARACTER_010_00_Description.text:
Retinue members can be tutored to improve their parameters.
Mr. S is the only tutor available at the beginning,
but pupils can become tutors themselves by training until they
acquire a special license—such training is more effective when
there is a large difference between the tutor's skill and that of
the pupil they are training. Note that members who are currently
in your combat retinue or have no LP cannot be tutored.

Tips_BT03_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_000_00_Description.text:
Parameters that increase as characters do battle.
A character's parameters are more likely to increase
following battles against mighty foes.
The parameters of mechs cannot increase.

Tips_BT03_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_001_00_Description.text:
<align='left'>Strength affects the following:
- The power of techs that require raw might
Compatible techs and spells:
<emoji Weapon_LongSword>longsword techs, <emoji Weapon_Ax>axe techs, <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>greatsword techs,
<emoji Weapon_Blade>katana techs, <emoji Weapon_Taijutsu>martial arts techs, <emoji Weapon_Mecha_Proximity>mech melee techs

Tips_BT03_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_002_00_Description.text:
<align='left'>Dexterity affects the following:
- The power of techs that require fine motor skills
- The likelihood of afflicting status ailments with techs
- Resistance to some ailments (<emoji BtlEffectParalysis>paralysis, <emoji BtlEffectStone>petrification, stun)
Compatible techs and spells:
<emoji Weapon_Knife>Dagger techs, <emoji Weapon_Blade>katana techs, <emoji Weapon_Halberd>halberd techs, <emoji Weapon_Handgun>one-handed gun techs, <emoji Weapon_machineGun>machine gun techs, <emoji Weapon_Flamethrower>flamethrower techs, <emoji Weapon_BombGun>boomer techs, <emoji Weapon_ChemicalGun>catalyzer techs, <emoji Weapon_Mecha_Shooting>mech shooting techs

Tips_BT03_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_003_00_Description.text:
<align='left'>Mobility affects the following:
- The power of techs that require nimble movement
Compatible techs and spells:
<emoji Weapon_FineSword>Foil techs, <emoji Weapon_Taijutsu>martial arts techs, <emoji Weapon_Mecha_Proximity>mech melee techs

Tips_BT03_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_004_00_Description.text:
<align='left'>Endurance affects the following:
- The power of techs that slam your body into an opponent's
- Reduction of damage caused by physical techs
- Resistance to some ailments (<emoji BtlEffectPoison>poison, <emoji BtlEffectStink>stench, sudden death)
- Recovery rate from some ailments (<emoji BtlEffectParalysis>paralysis, <emoji BtlEffectPoison>poison, <emoji BtlEffectStink>stench)
Compatible techs and spells:
<emoji Weapon_Taijutsu>Martial arts techs

Tips_BT03_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_005_00_Description.text:
<align='left'>Intelligence affects the following:
- The power of techs that require cleverness
- The likelihood of afflicting status ailments with spells
- Resistance to some ailments (<emoji BtlEffectConfusion>confusion, <emoji BtlEffectDarkness>darkness, distract)
Compatible techs and spells:
<emoji Weapon_Magic>Spells, <emoji Weapon_Mecha_Shooting>mech shooting techs

Tips_BT03_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_006_00_Description.text:
<align='left'>Acuity affects the following:
- Reduction of damage caused by non-physical techs
- Resistance to some ailments (<emoji BtlEffectParalysis>paralysis, <emoji BtlEffectPoison>poison, <emoji BtlEffectConfusion>confusion, <emoji BtlEffectDarkness>darkness, <emoji BtlEffectStone>petrification, <emoji BtlEffectStink>stench, stun, sudden death, distract)
- Recovery rate from some ailments (<emoji BtlEffectAnger>frenzy, <emoji BtlEffectConfusion>confusion, <emoji BtlEffectDarkness>darkness)

Tips_BT03_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_007_00_Description.text: Attacks that cause damage can be classified into seven types: slash, blunt, pierce, heat, cold, shock, and neutral. Characters also have resistances to these same attack types, and the greater one's resistance, the less damage they take from such attacks.

Tips_BT03_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_008_00_Description.text: In the world of SaGa Emerald Beyond, the universe is thought to be composed entirely of five distinct elements: wood, fire, earth, metal, and water. Spells typically correspond to one of the five elements; the higher one's skill level with an element, the more damage spells of that type will do.

Tips_BT03_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_009_00_Description.text: When you win battles in which you used techs and spells, there is a chance your skill levels corresponding to those actions will increase. The higher your skill level, the more damage corresponding actions will do. Some techs and spells are unaffected by skill levels, such as inherited techs and mech support techs. As your skill levels increase, you will unlock new slots in which roles can be equipped. Skill levels are more likely to increase following battles against tough foes.

Tips_BT03_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_010_00_Description.text: Characters grow more proficient with techs and spells the more they use them, which sometimes results in them ranking up. When a tech or spell's rank increases, it is typically improved in some way—such as reducing its BP cost or increases its power. Different techs and spells have different maximum ranks, which you'll know you've reached when the tech or spell is displayed with a crown symbol.

Tips_BT03_011_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT03_011_00_Description.text: Characters will sometimes glimmer new techs during battle. Should a glimmer occur, it will be added to that character's repertoire and performed on the spot, and is then available from the next turn on. The kinds of techs that can be glimmered depends on the weapon a character has equipped. Glimmers are more likely to occur during battles against mighty foes.

Tips_BT04_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_000_00_Description.text: Your retinue can consist of humanoids, kugutsu, monsters, and mechs, which differ from each other in a number of ways. In addition to having specific armaments they can equip, techs and spells they can perform, and roles they can use, they also grow in different ways.

Tips_BT04_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_001_00_Description.text: Humanoids consist of humans, vampires, knights, wastrels, and ephemerals. Of these, humans, vampires, knights, and ephemerals can learn techs by glimmering them.

Tips_BT04_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_002_00_Description.text: The defining trait of humans is their ability to use custom techs. Witches, who specialize in magic—as well as the squires who serve them—are human as well. Though humans can typically make use of a wide variety of techs and spells, it must be noted that squires are incapable of learning spells.

Tips_BT04_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_003_00_Description.text: Vampires can suck the blood of humanoids to increase the number of thralls and knights under their command. By equipping sanguine gear, they can also make use of sanguine roles.

Tips_BT_CHARACTER_016_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT_CHARACTER_016_00_Description.text: Vampires can turn humanoids into thralls by sucking their blood. The maximum LP of anyone turned into a thrall will be reduced by 1, but they will retain any racial traits they had originally. Vampires acquire LP and blood techs by turning humanoids into thralls.

Tips_BT_CHARACTER_018_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT_CHARACTER_018_00_Description.text: Vampires can turn thralls into knights by granting them special equipment called sanguine gear. A character who is knighted in this way will have their maximum LP increased by 3, and become able to use the same sanguine roles and blood techs that vampires do. Vampires are capable of swapping sanguine gear among knights. Once knighted, characters lose whatever racial traits they originally had.

Tips_BT04_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_004_00_Description.text: Knights turn into wastrels when divested of their sanguine gear by a vampire. Wastrels will have their maximum LP reduced to 1 and lose the ability to use both sanguine roles and blood techs. They will also lose the ability to learn new spells or glimmer new techs. A retinue member that has been turned into a wastrel can never be returned to their original state.

Tips_BT04_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_005_00_Description.text: When an ephemeral's LP reaches 0, they can carry over their fighting style, techs, and spells into their next life through a process called inheritance. They can also make use of special techs called inherited techs that are learned through the inheritance process. Note that some characters possess a combination of traits inherent to both ephemerals and monsters.

Tips_BT04_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_006_00_Description.text: Ephemerals are always equipped with an ephemeral role. As an ephemeral fights, their ephemeral role will gradually change from juvenile to young to mature, and finally to elder. The role grows stronger as it changes, but also decreases the character's maximum LP.

Tips_BT04_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_007_00_Description.text: Inheritance occurs when an ephemeral's LP runs out, causing their ephemeral role to change and starting the tech inheritance process. Skills that were improved during the ephemeral's previous life will be carried over, but there may be times where the fighting style they are most proficient in changes after they are reborn. The longer an ephemeral lives, the more inherited techs they can leave for future generations.

Tips_BT04_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_008_00_Description.text: Relic-bearers equip special armaments called relics. When a relic-bearer finishes off a monster in combat, they then absorb their abilities, making it possible to use monster techs. Only one monster can be absorbed per relic, so if you'd like to absorb a new monster, you must first unleash one that you've already absorbed.

Tips_BT04_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_009_00_Description.text: Kugutsu can equip items called souls, which allows the use of associated soul techs. While kugutsu cannot glimmer new techs, they can copy and learn techs used by other allies through a process called mimicking. Kugutsu can only equip a single weapon at a time.

Tips_BT04_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_010_00_Description.text: There are two types of souls: those that represent a character's very identity, and more general souls that can only be swapped out by a character who possesses the Kugutsu Puppetmaster role. General souls can be acquired by defeating enemies, These sometimes come with soul techs attached as well, which can be used if equipped after the soul has been set.

Tips_BT04_011_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_011_00_Description.text: Mimicking is an act which, provided the kugutsu has already performed a tech of their own, might occur if someone has performed a tech that can be performed with the weapon the kugutsu has equipped, and if said tech is of a higher rank than the techs in the kugutsu's possession or is a tech the kugutsu does not know yet. Note that some techs cannot be mimicked.

Tips_BT04_012_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_012_00_Description.text: Monsters make do with the weapons and main armor they were born with, meaning accessories are the only armaments they can equip. By equipping relics as accessories, they can also absorb and unleash other monsters. On top of that, they also possess monster-specific techs. Some monsters also possess traits inherent to ephemerals.

Tips_BT04_013_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_013_00_Description.text: Weapons, main armor, and auxiliaries can be equipped to any open slot. Techs will be automatically set depending on the armaments equipped. Mechs can perform three kinds of techs: mech melee techs, mech shooting techs, and mech support techs. What's more, should they be equipped with a relic, they can also make use of monster techs, and they will have the ability to Absorb and Unleash monsters as well.

Tips_BT05_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT05_003_00_Description.text:
Each protagonist has a special ability that makes them unique.
Using these will be key in each of their adventures.

Tips_BT05_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT05_000_00_Description.text: Kugutsu Puppetmaster is a role that can only be used by Tsunanori Mido. This role grants him the ability to swap out souls equipped to kugutsu, and also serves as proof he was born into a family of puppetmasters.

Tips_BT_CHARACTER_020_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT_CHARACTER_020_00_Description.text: By gathering cats that have been scattered across the worlds, Ameya can reclaim both her abilities and special cat items. Doing this increases not just the number of abilities at Ameya's disposal, but the power of her weapons as well. If you ever want to take a look at the furry feline friends you've collected, check out your Cat Album.

Tips_BT05_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT05_001_00_Description.text: As a vampire, Siugnas has the power to turn humanoids into thralls by sucking their blood. He can then turn his thralls into knights by giving them special armaments called sanguine gear. Try making good use of the Thrall Management screen, which is unlocked as you progress through his story.

Tips_BT_CHARACTER_019_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT_CHARACTER_019_00_Description.text:
Diva No. 5 is capable of switching <emoji Weapon_Mecha_big>mech frames.
Her HP, attributes, and resistances, as well as fixed techs and role, change based on her current <emoji Weapon_Mecha_big>mech frame.
Make good use of this ability to seize victory.

Tips_BT05_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT05_002_00_Description.text:
Bonnie and Formina take turns leading the group
depending on what's going on in the story.
While playing events that push the main story forward,
you will be able to remove them from your combat retinue,
but not from your support retinue.

Tips_BT06_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_000_00_Description.text: Even if your combo range is linked together properly, a United Attack won't activate if enemies also occupy it. But if you manage to defeat the enemy that's interfering with your United Attack or get it out of the way by, for example, hitting it with a delay attack, a United Attack will occur. If enemies and allies are jumbled together on the timeline, take a good look at your combo range and consider all of your options carefully. Furthermore, you'll want to keep in mind that blocking is impossible when your combo rate is high.

Tips_BT06_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_001_00_Description.text: When another ally joins a United Attack that's already in progress, an additional combo bonus will be added to your combo rate. For example, this bonus can occur in situations where an ally joins a United Attack with a chain or interrupt, or when a character that was previously not located within a United Attack's combo range gets added as a result of an enemy being defeated.

Tips_BT06_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_002_00_Description.text: Defeating an enemy during a United Attack will add a vanquish bonus to your combo rate. There may be times when it's worth leaving a low-health enemy alive so they can be used to secure a vanquish bonus the next time you perform a United Attack.

Tips_BT06_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_003_00_Description.text:
Defeating an enemy during a United Attack allows you to claim
the <emoji CoopRange01>combo range of the defeated enemy's tech for yourself.
Enemies that perform techs with a wide <emoji CoopRange01>combo range can be
difficult to deal with, but defeating one can open up the possibility of
working an ally positioned far away on the timeline into a United Attack.

Tips_BT06_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_004_00_Description.text: Should an ally who was supposed to participate in a United Attack fall immediately before it occurs, a vengeance bonus will be added to your combo rate, causing the United Attack to begin with an elevated combo rate. There may be some benefit in working near-death allies into your United Attacks assuming they might not get the chance to join.

Tips_BT06_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_005_00_Description.text: There may be times where an enemy is vulnerable to slash, blunt, pierce, heat, cold, or shock attacks. If they are, targeting them with an attack of that type will dish out a critical hit, causing more damage than usual. It isn't possible to block attacks that target vulnerabilities, so the return on actions that do so is typically quite good.

Tips_BT06_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_006_00_Description.text: The action order at the start of a turn is determined by your formation and the effects of equipped roles. It can also be affected by what techs a character performed (or had performed on them) the previous turn. If you would like more control over this aspect of combat, try choosing techs and spells that affect the action order. This can also be changed in the midst of combat by using conditional techs or attacks with delay effects.

Tips_BT06_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_007_00_Description.text: By not performing a tech or spell, a character will instead defend, allowing them to block or evade attacks. However, depending on what techs or spells a character uses and what weapon they have equipped, there are times when it is possible to block or evade even if attacking. Keep an eye out for weapons, techs, and spells that say they allow for blocking and evading before or after acting. Keep in mind that enemy techs can possess the same defensive properties.

Tips_BT06_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_008_00_Description.text: Enemies you'll fight along the way can be classified into the following races: beasts, spirits, plants, reptiles, aquatic life-forms, substances, insects, winged, demons, elements, mechs, humans, and vampires. Some techs and spells possess race-specific effectiveness that causes them to deal additional damage when used against enemies of specific races.

Tips_BT06_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_009_00_Description.text: Airborne foes can be particularly difficult to land clean hits on. Should you have trouble making contact with airborne foes, try using attacks that have antiair properties.

Tips_BT06_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_010_00_Description.text:
Objects that appear as enemies in battle come in varying levels
of durability, with some being easier to destroy than others.
Each object has its own type resistances, so if you come up
against an object you had difficulty destroying in the past,
perhaps try hitting it with attacks of a different type.

Tips_BT06_011_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_011_00_Description.text: The more a retinue member attacks an enemy, the more likely that enemy is to attack them back. Using techs or spells with a provoke effect will increase your chances of being targeted even more.

Tips_BT06_012_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_012_00_Description.text: Emerging victorious in combat can cause your battle rank to increase. The rate at which it increases is sped up by winning difficult battles, winning with few casualties, or winning battles where your own retinue is more powerful than your enemy. Raising your battle rank impacts the strength, variety, and number of enemies you encounter throughout the game—and when your foes are tougher, the HP, parameters, and skill levels of your own characters grow more quickly as well. Furthermore, the higher your battle rank is, the more likely you are to glimmer new techniques. There is a limit to how high your battle rank can get at any given point, and changing worlds will make it so that it can go up again. Winning easy battles will not cause your battle rank to increase. Battle rewards will double once you've reached the maximum battle rank.

Tips_BT07_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_000_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>general one-handed sword techs, <emoji Weapon_LongSword>longsword techs, <emoji Weapon_FineSword>foil techs, <emoji Weapon_Knife>dagger techs, <emoji Weapon_Ax>axe techs, <emoji Weapon_TwoSwords>dual-wield techs, and <emoji Weapon_GunSword>sword & gun techs.

Tips_BT07_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_001_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>general two-handed sword techs, <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>greatsword techs, <emoji Weapon_Blade>katana techs, and <emoji Weapon_Halberd>halberd techs.

Tips_BT07_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_002_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedFirearm>one-handed gun techs, <emoji Weapon_TwoGun>guns akimbo techs, and <emoji Weapon_GunSword>sword & gun techs.

Tips_BT07_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_003_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>general two-handed gun techs, <emoji Weapon_machineGun>machine gun techs, <emoji Weapon_Flamethrower>flamethrower techs, <emoji Weapon_ElectricGun>zapper techs, <emoji Weapon_BombGun>boomer techs, and <emoji Weapon_ChemicalGun>catalyzer techs.

Tips_BT07_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_004_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_Taijutsu_big>martial arts techs.

Tips_BT07_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_005_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_Magu_big>monster techs.

Tips_BT07_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_006_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_Mecha_Proximity>mech melee techs.

Tips_BT07_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT07_007_00_Description.text: Affects the power of <emoji Weapon_Mecha_Shooting>mech shooting techs.

Tips_BT08_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_000_00_Description.text:
A number of weapon types are classified as <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed swords,
and such techs can be used no matter which one-handed weapon you wield. <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>One-handed sword techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_001_00_Description.text:
<emoji Weapon_LongSword>Longswords are a type of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword that
allow the use of <emoji Weapon_LongSword>longsword techs.
Many <emoji Weapon_LongSword>longsword techs allow their user to act quickly,
and they greatly increase combo rates when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_002_00_Description.text:
<emoji Weapon_FineSword>Foils are a type of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword that
allow the use of <emoji Weapon_FineSword>foil techs.
Although <emoji Weapon_FineSword>foil techs are typically <emoji Stab>piercing in nature,
there are many that do <emoji Ice>cold or <emoji Lightning>shock damage as well,
letting their user cover a wide variety of attack types.
<emoji Weapon_FineSword>Foil techs greatly increase your combo rate
when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_003_00_Description.text:
<emoji Weapon_Knife>Daggers are a type of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword that
allow the use of <emoji Weapon_Knife>dagger techs.
One interesting thing about <emoji Weapon_Knife>dagger techs is that
they do not generate much enmity. 
<emoji Weapon_Knife>Dagger techs greatly increase your combo rate
when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_004_00_Description.text:
<emoji Weapon_Ax>Axes are a type of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword that
allow the use of <emoji Weapon_Ax>axe techs.
While <emoji Weapon_Ax>axe techs boast impressive power, they have poor
accuracy compared to other <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed swords.
<emoji Weapon_Ax>Axe techs greatly increase your combo rate
when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_005_00_Description.text:
Techs that can be performed when a character has
two <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed swords equipped.
In addition to the above condition, a character must also
be equipped with the special <emoji Role_Common>Seasoned Duelist role
to gain access to these techs. Dual-wield techs greatly
increase your combo rate when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_006_00_Description.text:
Techs that can be performed when a character has both
a <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword and a <emoji Weapon_OneHandedFirearm>one-handed gun equipped.
In addition to the above condition, a character must also
be equipped with the special <emoji Role_Common>Sword & Gun Master role
to gain access to these techs. Sword & gun techs greatly
increase your combo rate when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_007_00_Description.text:
A number of weapon types are classified as <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed swords,
and such techs can be used no matter which two-handed weapon you wield. An interesting thing about <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword techs is that they generate large amounts of enmity. <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>Two-handed sword techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_008_00_Description.text: <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>Greatswords are a type of <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword that allow the use of <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>greatsword techs. <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>Greatsword techs possess a variety of properties, granting their wielders access to attacks that deal <emoji Slash>slash, <emoji Strike>blunt, and <emoji Stab> pierce damage. An interesting thing about <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>greatsword techs is that they generate large amounts of enmity. <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>Greatsword techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_009_00_Description.text: <emoji Weapon_Blade>Katana are a type of <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword that allow the use of <emoji Weapon_Blade>katana techs. Those who wield a <emoji Weapon_Blade>katana will have access to conditional techs like interrupts and counterattacks. An interesting thing about <emoji Weapon_Blade>katana techs is that they generate large amounts of enmity. <emoji Weapon_Blade>Katana techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_010_00_Description.text:
<emoji Weapon_Halberd>Halberds are a type of <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword that
allow the use of <emoji Weapon_Halberd>halberd techs.
Many of this weapon's techs slow the wielder's action order.
An interesting thing about <emoji Weapon_Halberd>halberd techs
is that they generate large amounts of enmity.
<emoji Weapon_Halberd>Halberd techs greatly increase your combo rate
when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_011_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_011_00_Description.text: Techs that can be used when equipped with a one-handed gun. Those who wield a one-handed gun will have access to conditional techs like chains and interrupts. Many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. One-handed gun techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_012_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_012_00_Description.text: Techs that can be performed when a character has two one-handed guns equipped. In addition to the above condition, a character must also be equipped with the special Guns Blazing role to gain access to these techs. Many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Guns akimbo techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_013_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_013_00_Description.text: A number of weapon types are classified as two-handed guns, and such techs can be used no matter which two-handed gun you wield. Many of this weapon's techs slow the wielder's action order. Two-handed gun techs generate large amounts of enmity, and many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Two-handed gun techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_014_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_014_00_Description.text: Machine guns are a type of two-handed gun that allow the use of machine gun techs. An interesting thing about machine gun techs is that they generate large amounts of enmity. Many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Machine gun techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_015_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_015_00_Description.text: Flamethrowers are a type of two-handed gun that allow the use of flamethrower techs. All of this weapon's techs have heat properties. An interesting thing about flamethrower techs is that they generate large amounts of enmity. Many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Flamethrower techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_016_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_016_00_Description.text: Zappers are a type of two-handed gun that allow the use of zapper techs. Zappers have techs with shock properties, as well as techs that cause ailments like stun and paralysis. Zapper techs generate large amounts of enmity, and many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Zapper techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_017_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_017_00_Description.text: Boomers are a type of two-handed gun that allow the use of boomer techs. Many of this weapon's techs slow the wielder's action order. An interesting thing about boomer techs is that they generate large amounts of enmity. Many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Boomer techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_018_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_018_00_Description.text: Catalyzers are a type of two-handed gun that allow the use of catalyzer techs. Catalyzers have techs with cold properties, as well as techs that cause poison and reduce enemy parameters. Catalyzer techs generate large amounts of enmity, and many of their attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Catalyzer techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in showstoppers.

Tips_BT08_019_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_019_00_Description.text: <emoji Weapon_Taijutsu>Martial arts techs can be used when a character has no weapons equipped. Punches possess properties that let the user <emoji GuardBehind>defend after they act, meaning they can evade the attacks of those who act after they do. What's more, many kick techs allow the user to act quickly, and body slams can be used to slow down one's action order. <emoji Weapon_Taijutsu>Martial arts techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_020_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_020_00_Description.text: Through the repeated use of techs, humans can learn unique techs based on existing moves. These are called custom techs.

Tips_BT08_021_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_021_00_Description.text: Techs that are attached to souls are called soul techs. These can only be used by kugutsu. To make use of them, equip a soul and then make sure to separately set the soul tech attached to it.

Tips_BT08_022_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_022_00_Description.text: Techs used by vampires and knights. Using them consumes LP. The use of blood techs greatly increases your combo rate. Unlike techs held by individuals, blood techs are assigned to the entire retinue, so they can only be equipped to one person at a time. More can be acquired by turning humanoids into thralls.

Tips_BT08_023_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_023_00_Description.text:
Techs used by ephemerals.
Many of these afflict status ailments
or have parameter-increasing effects.
These are not impacted by skill levels.

Tips_BT08_024_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_024_00_Description.text:
Techs used by monsters, relic-bearers, or mechs who
are equipped with relics that contain absorbed monsters.
If the tech is something the monster already possessed
they will simply perform the attacks themselves.
Otherwise, relic-bearers unleash the monsters contained
in their relics to attack in their stead.

Tips_BT08_025_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_025_00_Description.text:
Should a monster, relic-bearer, or mech equipped with an
empty relic defeat a monster, that monster will be absorbed.

Tips_BT08_026_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_026_00_Description.text: As the name suggests, Unleash is a tech by which one can unleash a monster from a relic. Unleashing a monster will activate a monster tech that deals immense damage in exchange for your HP.

Tips_BT08_027_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_027_00_Description.text:
Techs used by mechs. In general, these will be automatically
set when a mech is equipped with a <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword
or a <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword.
<emoji Weapon_Mecha_Proximity>Mech melee techs greatly increase your combo rate
when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_028_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_028_00_Description.text: Techs used by mechs. In general, these will be automatically set when a mech is equipped with a one-handed gun or a two-handed gun. Many of these attacks possess antiair properties, making them effective against airborne enemies. Mech shooting techs greatly increase your combo rate when used in United Attacks.

Tips_BT08_029_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_029_00_Description.text:
Techs used by mechs. In general, these will be automatically
set when a mech is equipped with <emoji Weapon_MainArmor_big><emoji Weapon_SubArmor_big>armor.
<emoji Weapon_Mecha_Support>Mech support techs are not affected by skills.

Tips_BT08_030_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_030_00_Description.text: Unlike techs, every spell corresponds to one of the five elements, and must be chanted for a number of turns before it can be cast. If your skill level in an element is 1 or higher, casting a spell of that element gives you a chance to learn one of its spells, with the chance increasing the higher your magic skill, intelligence, and corresponding skill level in the element.

Tips_BT08_031_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_031_00_Description.text: Techs that will not activate unless specific conditions are met are called conditional techs. There are five types of these in all: interrupts, counterattacks, protects, chains, and pursuits. A character that has chosen one of these techs is in a conditional state. When an enemy chooses a conditional tech, their action will be displayed as '???', which is a sign that a conditional tech is in play. A target will have their conditional state removed if they are attacked by a tech that possesses a quell effect.

Tips_BT08_032_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_032_00_Description.text: Conditional techs known as interrupts can be used to preempt an enemy's action with one of your own. Interrupts are activated in response to an enemy using a tech with either slash, blunt, or pierce properties.

Tips_BT08_033_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_033_00_Description.text: Conditional techs known as counterattacks can be used to nullify an enemy's attack and fire back with one of your own. While all counterattacks are devastatingly powerful, not only can they sometimes fail, but there are some attacks that cannot be counterattacked—including quells and attacks that target the entire retinue. Use counterattacks with caution!

Tips_BT08_034_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_034_00_Description.text: Conditional techs known as protects can be used to have a character take attacks meant for an ally. Protecting an ally in this way reduces damage taken. Protects are useful in situations where you want to keep an ally who's near death in the fight. Unique among protects is the Parry technique, which has the user defend their own person and completely nullify attacks that target them.

Tips_BT08_035_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_035_00_Description.text: Conditional techs known as chains can be used to perform a tech immediately after an ally acts. Jumping in immediately after an ally's attack can create advantageous situations if it causes combo ranges to connect, but there are also times where it can disrupt combo ranges instead, so plan carefully.

Tips_BT08_036_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT08_036_00_Description.text: Conditional techs known as pursuits can be used to perform a tech immediately after an enemy acts. Pursuits are great for disrupting United Attacks.

Tips_BT09_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_000_00_Description.text:
There are four types of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed swords:
<emoji Weapon_LongSword>longswords, <emoji Weapon_FineSword>foils, <emoji Weapon_Knife>daggers, and <emoji Weapon_Ax>axes.
Will block when defending.

Tips_BT09_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_001_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>general one-handed sword techs and <emoji Weapon_LongSword>longsword techs.

Tips_BT09_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_002_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>general one-handed sword techs and <emoji Weapon_FineSword>foil techs.

Tips_BT09_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_003_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>general one-handed sword techs and <emoji Weapon_Knife>dagger techs.

Tips_BT09_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_004_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>one-handed sword weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_OneHandedSword>general one-handed sword techs and <emoji Weapon_Ax>axe techs.

Tips_BT09_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_005_00_Description.text:
There are three types of <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed swords:
<emoji Weapon_LargeSword>greatswords, <emoji Weapon_Blade>katana, and <emoji Weapon_Halberd>halberds.
Will block when defending.

Tips_BT09_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_006_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>general two-handed sword techs and <emoji Weapon_LargeSword>greatsword techs.

Tips_BT09_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_007_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>general two-handed sword techs and <emoji Weapon_Blade>katana techs.

Tips_BT09_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_008_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>two-handed sword weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedSword>general two-handed sword techs and <emoji Weapon_Halberd>halberd techs.

Tips_BT09_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_009_00_Description.text:
Allows the use of <emoji Weapon_OneHandedFirearm>one-handed gun techs.
Will evade when defending.

Tips_BT09_011_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_011_00_Description.text:
There are five types of <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>two-handed guns:
<emoji Weapon_machineGun>machine guns, <emoji Weapon_Flamethrower>flamethrowers, <emoji Weapon_ElectricGun>zappers, <emoji Weapon_BombGun>boomers,
and <emoji Weapon_ChemicalGun>catalyzers.
Will block when defending.

A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>two-handed gun weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>general two-handed gun techs and <emoji Weapon_machineGun>machine gun techs.

A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>two-handed gun weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>general two-handed gun techs and <emoji Weapon_Flamethrower>flamethrower techs.

Tips_BT09_014_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT09_014_00_Description.text:
A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>two-handed gun weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>general two-handed gun techs and <emoji Weapon_ElectricGun>zapper techs.

A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>two-handed gun weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>general two-handed gun techs and <emoji Weapon_BombGun>boomer techs.

A <emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>two-handed gun weapon that allows the use of
<emoji Weapon_DoubleHandedFirearm>general two-handed gun techs and <emoji Weapon_ChemicalGun>catalyzer techs.

Tips_BT10_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT10_000_00_Description.text:
Armaments that bolster the wearer's defenses.
Increases the wearer's resistances.

Tips_BT10_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT10_006_00_Description.text:
Armaments that bolster the wearer's defenses.
Slightly increases the wearer's resistances.
There are five types of auxiliary armor: <emoji Weapon_Armor_Head>head armor, <emoji Weapon_Armor_Clothes>clothes,
<emoji Weapon_Armor_Hand>hand armor, <emoji Weapon_Armor_Shoes>leg armor, and <emoji Weapon_Armor_Accessories>accessories.

Tips_BT10_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT10_001_00_Description.text:
A type of <emoji Weapon_SubArmor_big>auxiliary armor.
Many head armaments raise <emoji Strike>blunt resistance.

Tips_BT10_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT10_002_00_Description.text:
A type of <emoji Weapon_SubArmor_big>auxiliary armor.
Clothing armaments provide a variety of resistances.

Tips_BT10_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT10_003_00_Description.text:
A type of <emoji Weapon_SubArmor_big>auxiliary armor.
Many hand armaments raise <emoji Slash>slash resistance.

Tips_BT10_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT10_004_00_Description.text:
A type of <emoji Weapon_SubArmor_big>auxiliary armor.
Many leg armaments raise <emoji Stab>pierce resistance.

Tips_BT10_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT10_005_00_Description.text:
A type of <emoji Weapon_SubArmor_big>auxiliary armor.
These confer a variety of effects.

Tips_BT11_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT11_000_00_Description.text: Cat items consist of cat weapons and cat accessories. The power of cat weapons increases the more cats you collect.

Tips_BT11_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT11_001_00_Description.text: Special armaments that house the power of vampires. These can be created by taking an armament to serve as its base and applying a special concept to it. Also, each piece of sanguine gear comes with a sanguine role attached. Sanguine roles can only be equipped and used by vampires or knights that have been conferred sanguine gear.

Tips_BT11_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT11_002_00_Description.text: Relics that have absorbed monsters modify the parameters of their bearers. Unleashing a monster from a relic will cause those modifiers to disappear, so be sure to handle relics with care.

Tips_BT12_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT12_000_00_Description.text:
An increase in speed hastens one's action order,
as well as increasing their accuracy rate.
A decrease, conversely, has the opposite effect.
This effect can be applied multiple times.
This effect persists for the duration of the battle
in which it is activated.

Tips_BT12_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT12_001_00_Description.text:
An increase in attack power causes non-spell
attacks to deal more damage.
A decrease, conversely, causes them to do less.
This effect can be applied multiple times.
This effect persists for the duration of the battle
in which it is activated.

Tips_BT12_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT12_002_00_Description.text:
An increase in defense reduces the amount of damage taken.
A decrease, conversely, will result in more damage taken.
This effect can be applied multiple times.
This effect persists for the duration of the battle
in which it is activated.

Tips_BT12_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT12_003_00_Description.text:
An increase in spell power causes spells to deal more damage.
A decrease, conversely, causes them to do less.
This effect can be applied multiple times.
This effect persists for the duration of the battle
in which it is activated.

Tips_BT13_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_000_00_Description.text: Causes the afflicted character to become inactionable for that turn and cancels whatever action they had prepared. Should a character chanting a spell be stunned, both chant and spell will be canceled. A target is more likely to succumb to stun at low levels of HP.

Tips_BT13_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_001_00_Description.text: Renders the afflicted character inactionable for a while. A target is more likely to succumb to paralysis at low levels of HP. This status clears up after a set number of turns.

Tips_BT13_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_002_00_Description.text: Causes the afflicted character to take damage each turn. A target is more likely to succumb to poison at low levels of HP. This status clears up after a set number of turns.

Tips_BT13_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_003_00_Description.text: Reduces the afflicted character's accuracy. A target is more likely to succumb to darkness at low levels of HP. This status clears up after a set number of turns.

Tips_BT13_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_004_00_Description.text: Nullifies the afflicted character's tech and spell combo range, making it impossible for them to participate in United Attacks. A target is more likely to succumb to stench at low levels of HP. This status clears up after a set number of turns. Should a character's stench status clear up before they perform their action for that turn, their combo range will recover as well.

Tips_BT13_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_005_00_Description.text: Should a target's enmity reach a high level after being targeted by techs that possess a provoke effect, they will sometimes enter a state called frenzy that forces them to attack the target of their enmity and causes them to deal more damage. This status persists until either the target of their enmity has been defeated, or a set number of turns has passed.

Tips_BT13_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_006_00_Description.text: A character afflicted with confusion will act of their own accord for a time and the combo range of any techs and spells they perform will nullify United Attacks. Furthermore, they are prone to performing chains after allies act, ruining any United Attacks that could have otherwise happened. A target is more likely to succumb to confusion at low levels of HP. This status clears up after a set number of turns.

Tips_BT13_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_007_00_Description.text: Increases the number of turns required to cast a spell. A target is more likely to get distracted at low levels of HP.

Tips_BT13_008_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_008_00_Description.text: A status that renders the afflicted unable to act. They will, however, also not take damage or be impacted by a variety of other effects. Should your entire combat retinue be petrified during a battle, it will be treated as a loss—so be careful when your enemies are capable of afflicting this ailment. A target is more likely to succumb to petrification at low levels of HP. This status will not clear up on its own.

Tips_BT13_009_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT13_009_00_Description.text: Successfully inflicting sudden death upon a target will immediately incapacitate them, removing them from battle. A target is more likely to succumb to sudden death at low levels of HP.

Tips_BT14_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT14_000_00_Description.text: A status ailment that can only be suffered by mechs. The afflicted character's action for that turn will be canceled, and they will be left in an inactionable state. A target is more likely to succumb to a mech stun at low levels of HP.

Tips_BT14_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT14_001_00_Description.text: A status ailment that can only be suffered by mechs. The afflicted character will be left unable to act for a period of time. A target is more likely to succumb to mech paralysis at low levels of HP. This status clears up after a set number of turns.

Tips_BT15_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT15_000_00_Description.text:
Nullifies damage one time.
This effect persists until an attack is nullified.

Tips_BT15_001_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT15_001_00_Description.text:
Renders the target immune to status effects.
This effect persists for a set number of turns.

Tips_BT15_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT15_002_00_Description.text:
Renders the target immune to mech stun and <emoji BtlEffectParalysisMech>mech paralysis.
This effect persists for a set number of turns.

Tips_BT15_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT15_003_00_Description.text:
Affects the <emoji BtlBPCost>BP cost of actions performed.
This effect persists for the duration of the battle
in which it is activated.

Tips_BT15_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT15_004_00_Description.text:
Affects the power of techs and spells.
This effect persists for a set number of turns,
with the effect growing weaker each turn.

Tips_BT15_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT15_005_00_Description.text:
Expands your <emoji CoopRange01>combo range, making it easier to perform
United Attacks. This effect persists for the duration of the battle
in which it is activated.

Tips_BT16_000_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_000_00_Description.text: Moves the target's action order back on the timeline. There also exists something called an area delay, which can affect all enemies grouped within a certain range on the timeline. Furthermore, you'll want to keep in mind that delays will not affect someone who has successfully blocked the delaying move while alive.

Tips_BT16_002_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_002_00_Description.text: Techs and spells with the unblockable effect cannot be blocked. They can, however, be evaded.

Tips_BT16_003_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_003_00_Description.text: Attacking an enemy with a tech that has a provoke effect can put that enemy into a frenzy state. Should that happen, they will become unable to attack anyone but the character who put them into that state. This can be useful when trying to focus an enemy's attacks on a single character or when aiming for a counterattack.

Tips_BT16_004_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_004_00_Description.text:
Reduces the number of turns required to chant a spell.
This will have no effect if a spell only has one turn of
chanting left until it is cast.

Tips_BT16_005_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_005_00_Description.text:
Makes a character less likely to be targeted by enemies.
Should a character initiate stealth after they are already
being targeted by an enemy, the enemy that lost sight
of its target will attack someone else instead.
Furthermore, if a character that was the target of an
enemy's frenzy initiates stealth, that enemy's frenzy
status will be removed.

Tips_BT16_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_006_00_Description.text:
Removes a target's <emoji BtlEffectAnger>frenzy status and resets
the enmity (likelihood of being targeted by an enemy)
state of all allies.

Tips_BT16_007_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_007_00_Description.text: Changes the amount of <emoji BtlBPCost>BP available in the next round.

Tips_BT16_010_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT16_010_00_Description.text: Removes any special effects applied to a target.

Tips_BA_006_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BA_006_00_Description.text: Upon completing the game, information pertaining to categories that can be carried over into future playthroughs will be updated. In general, the greatest value a category has ever reached will be saved, but items and monster-absorption status will always retain whatever state they were in when that playthrough was completed. Your completion status will be carried over if enabled, or completely reset if disabled. If you're unsure of what to do, we suggest using the default settings.

Tips_BT04_014_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT04_014_00_Description.text: Roles are one way you can change how characters fight. In addition to standard roles that represent a character's position or personality, there are also souls that can only be equipped by kugutsu, ephemeral roles that can only be equipped by ephemerals, and sanguine roles that can only be equipped by vampires and knights.

Tips_BT06_013_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_013_00_Description.text: When in overdrive, techs and spells with BP costs equal to or less than those used when participating in the United Attack that sparked it will be automatically chosen. Note that conditional techs, blood techs, and techs that cannot combo will not be chosen for overdrive combos, and that attacks performed while in overdrive are unblockable. For showstoppers, you will receive one additional BP before it begins, and techs and spells will be automatically chosen from among those you have equipped (with the exception of blood techs, which cannot be used in showstoppers). When you no longer have any BP left during a showstopper, the final tech or spell will be chosen with no regard for how much BP it costs.

Tips_BT06_014_00_Description.speaker: UI
Tips_BT06_014_00_Description.text:
The BP cost of spells chosen automatically during overdrives
or showstoppers is determined by the act that sparked it.
If an overdrive or showstopper was sparked by a spell,
the BP cost of the spells it uses will be as normal.
If an overdrive or showstopper is sparked by a tech,
the BP cost of spells it uses will equal the spell's normal
BP cost plus the number of turns needed to chant it.
